definition: start of play/opening of theatrical performance

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
opening gong/gong strokes announcing start of opera performance

sentences.english: Then, send the manager to the stands for his outburst.
sentences.chinese: 第二，因爲主教練的罵人行爲而將他送上開臺。

sentences.english: Founding and commodities in accordance with the realization of the functional checkout of the day.
sentences.chinese: 按開臺和商品實現的日結賬功能。

sentences.english: But he had to drive something, right?
sentences.chinese: 不過想一想，他總得開臺什麼東西，是吧？
